__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have tested a bug put your name in the last column.   This will let people know that the bug in that row has been tested by you!  If you are the second person to test a bug set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:
 
* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20080624
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual 
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20080624

More information about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day#Tag|tags here]]</nowiki>.

=== 22 bugs needing verification in Main ===
Today is a very special bug day where we are working on moving bugs from Fix Committed to Fix Released.  The actual status change of the bug report will be done by the Archive Admins.  Generally, this is done automatically however we are looking at possible package updates for a stable release of Ubuntu - Hardy Heron.  The bug fixes and the packages need testing.  And we can help by doing that testing!

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Recreate the original bug '''and'''
* Install the -proposed package '''and'''
* Verify that bug is fixed '''then'''
* Add a comment to the bug indicating your testing
